sentences.english: The guards often yelled at him and the other prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 警卫对他和其他囚犯厉声呵斥。

sentences.english: She cries out to Scarpia and leaps from the battlement.
sentences.chinese: 她厉声呼喊迫卡皮亚，并从城垛上纵身一跃。

sentences.english: The officer rapped out the orders.
He always raps his instructions out, as though he were still in the army.
sentences.chinese: 他老是厉声发出命令，好像他还在部队里。

sentences.english: When I asked what was upsetting her so, she snapped at me.
sentences.chinese: 我问她是什么使她如此烦恼，她则厉声斥责我。

sentences.english: Programmers constantly improve their knowledge and usage of their tools.
sentences.chinese: 程序员会不断的厉声自己的知识和对工具的掌握。

sentences.english: She barked orders at her subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 她厉声向她部下下命令。

sentences.english: "You're certainly making a beautiful noise, " snapped the old sheep.
sentences.chinese: “你真会制造嗓音啊”那只老绵羊突然厉声说。

sentences.english: Mark snaps as he climbs back into the cockpit.
sentences.chinese: 马克一边厉声地说，一边钻进驾驶舱。

sentences.english: The coach cussed out the team for losing.
sentences.chinese: 教练因球队输球而厉声训斥队员。

sentences.english: The judge rapped the police for their treatment of the witness.
sentences.chinese: 法官因警察对待证人的态度而厉声斥责他们。

sentences.english: Maurice took out the garbage only after his wife cracked the whip.
sentences.chinese: 莫理斯总是等到他太太厉声厉气后，才会去到垃圾。

sentences.english: “Of course, ” he snapped with ironical arrogance.
sentences.chinese: “当然，”他带着讽刺的傲慢厉声说道。

sentences.english: His father rapped out an answer and then left the room.
sentences.chinese: 他的父亲厉声回答，然后离开了房间。

sentences.english: The chair sternly rebuked the audience for their laughter.
sentences.chinese: 主席厉声斥责听众哄笑。

definition: (of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to shout an order or command
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to suddenly change color showing displeasure, bewilderment etc
